overview_of_class: This course presents a smorgasbord of topics related to money and banking. Topics range from financial markets and the term structure of interest rates to the structure and role of banks and the Federal Reserve System to monetary theory and policy.
name: Money and Banking
title: WCAS ECON 308-0-20 Money and Banking

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course presents a smorgasbord of topics related to money and banking. Topics range from financial markets and the term structure of interest rates to the structure and role of banks and the Federal Reserve System to monetary theory and policy.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: I'll assume knowledge of the material of Economics 310-1 and 311 for this class.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: A typical week features two lectures and a discussion section.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: There will be one midterm exam during the quarter and a final exam. There will also be an assignment to be turned in and a paper. Each of the exams will account for 40% of the possible points. The assignment to be turned in will account for 5% of the total points while the paper accounts for the remaining 15%. While a grade for class discussion will not be assigned, class discussion will definitely be considered in the case of a borderline grade.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: The text for the course is Money, Banking, and Financial Markets, 4th ed. by Cecchetti & Schoenholtz (ISBN: 978-0078021749). Also required is A Random Walk Down Wall Street, 11th ed. by Burton G. Malkiel (ISBN: 978-0393246117). Additional readings will be made available during the quarter.

subject: ECON
